str2: Middle, in the middle, between, in the midst of. From meta; middle (neuter) noun).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A lamp-stand. From luchnos; a lamp-stand.
Like, similar to, resembling, of equal rank. From the base of homou; similar.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To put on, clothe (another). From en and duno; to invest with clothing.
Golden, made of gold, adorned with gold. From chrusos; made of gold.
Probably akin to the base of zugos; a belt; by implication, a pocket.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From peri and zonnumi; to gird all around, i.e. to fasten on one's belt.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The breast, pap. From the base of massaomai; a breast.
